statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Franklin Porter made a key 3-pointer and finished with 16 points to lead Portland to a 72-65 victory over Loyola Marymount on Saturday night.
article.headline: Porter scores 16; Portland holds off Loyola Marymount 72-65
article.linkText: Porter scores 16; Portland holds off Loyola Marymount 72-65
article.story: LOS ANGELES -- Franklin Porter made a key 3-pointer and finished with 16 points to lead Portland to a 72-65 victory over Loyola Marymount on Saturday night. Portland (8-13, 2-6 West Coast Conference) has won consecutive games since snapping a six-game losing skid. Loyola Marymount (6-13, 1-7) has lost three straight and nine of its last 10 games. Steven Haney made a 3-pointer and James Batemon added three points during a 6-0 spurt that pulled the Lions to 63-56. The Pilots were scoreless for nearly four minutes before Porter's 3-pointer made it 66-56. Another 6-0 surge cut the Lions' deficit to 66-62, but the Pilots shot 6 of 8 from the line to seal it. Tahirou Diabate added 14 points for the Pilots. Marcus Shaver Jr. chipped in 13 points and JoJo Walker had 12. Batemon scored 18 points to lead Loyola Marymount, which missed 20 shots from long range and finished 24-of-65 shooting (37 percent) from the field.
